Tonight, the UFC will hold its latest event in Melbourne, Australia, having previously hosted three events in the city.

Headlining the card at the Marvel Stadium is a middleweight battle between Robert Whittaker and Isreal Adesanya, both of whom are yet to lose.

Adesanya has the slight height advantage on his opponent, standing at 1.93m, compared to Whittaker, who stands at 1.83m.

The co-main event sees the unbeaten Dan Hooker face the American Al Laquinta.

Here’s everything you need to know about the card, including how you can watch the action at no cost...

What time will UFC 243 start in the UK?

The preliminary fights will get underway at 1am, with the main card kicking off at 3.00am. The main event should start at around 5.30am.

(Image: Getty Images)

What channel is UFC 243 on?

The main and preliminary fights will be shown live on BT Sport 1 from 1am.

However, if you don't have BT Sport, you can watch the prelims on the UFC's Fight Pass service .

Can I live stream UFC 243 online?

BT Sport customers can watch the full card via the BT Sport website and App, via their mobile.

Can I live stream UFC 243 for free?

UK fans can watch fights for free if you are an EE mobile customer.

By texting SPORT to 150, registering for a BT ID and then downloading the BT Sport app, you can enjoy three months' of BT Sport for free.

This subscription can be cancelled at any time during the trial.
